intro: Mulgedium centrale, commonly known as the central mulgedium, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly serrated edge. Mulgedium centrale is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
